title: Vocabulary in Context
description: Determine word meaning from context clues

questions.question: 'The teacher's explanation was so lucid that even the youngest students understood.' What does 'lucid' mean here?
'After the long winter, the garden showed signs of rejuvenation with new buds appearing everywhere.' What does 'rejuvenation' mean?
options: The process of becoming young or fresh again

questions.question: 'The politician's speech was full of rhetoric but lacked any concrete proposals.' What does 'rhetoric' mean here?
options: Persuasive or impressive language that may lack substance

questions.question: 'She showed great fortitude during the difficult months of her recovery.' What does 'fortitude' mean?
options: Courage and strength in facing adversity

questions.question: 'The ephemeral beauty of the cherry blossoms drew crowds every spring, knowing they would last only days.' What does 'ephemeral' mean?
options: Lasting only a very short time

questions.question: 'His verbose letters, often running to ten pages, exhausted even his most patient friends.' What does 'verbose' mean?
options: Using more words than needed; long-winded

questions.question: 'The diplomat was known for her tactful handling of sensitive negotiations.' What does 'tactful' mean?
options: Having a keen sense of what to say to avoid offense

questions.question: 'The magnanimous host insisted on paying for everyone's dinner despite his modest means.' What does 'magnanimous' mean?
options: Generous and forgiving, especially toward a rival

questions.question: 'The old mansion had a dilapidated roof that leaked whenever it rained.' What does 'dilapidated' mean?
options: In a state of disrepair or ruin

questions.question: 'Her pragmatic approach to the problem saved the company both time and money.' What does 'pragmatic' mean?
options: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically

questions.question: 'The children were jubilant when they heard school had been canceled for a snow day.' What does 'jubilant' mean?
'The frugal grandmother always found ways to stretch her grocery budget.' What does 'frugal' mean?
options: Sparing or economical with money or resources

questions.question: 'His candid remarks about the company's problems surprised the board members.' What does 'candid' mean?
'The tenacious detective refused to give up on the cold case after twenty years.' What does 'tenacious' mean?
options: Tending to keep a firm hold; persistent

questions.question: 'The ubiquitous coffee shops on every corner made it easy to find a morning cup.' What does 'ubiquitous' mean?
